meanings.definition: A curved flat piece of wood that can be thrown in such a way that it will return to the thrower.
meanings.sent1: I threw the boomerang and it came back to me.
meanings.sent2: The boomerang flew through the air and then circled back to me.
meanings.sent3: The boomerang decided it wanted to play catch too!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a boomerang, always coming back to haunt her.
meanings.sent5: The boomerang's path was like a dance in the sky, returning gracefully.

meanings.definition: To have the opposite effect to what was intended.
meanings.sent1: His plan to impress her with a joke boomeranged and made her upset.
meanings.sent2: The prank boomeranged on him, causing embarrassment instead of laughter.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to surprise him backfired and boomeranged on her instead.
meanings.sent4: Trying to outsmart the system often ends up boomeranging on oneself.
meanings.sent5: His lie boomeranged, revealing the truth in a surprising twist.
